segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and it’s actually kind of funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to notice the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and I can’t help but laugh at how clueless he is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is one of those moments that’s so ridiculous it’s almost charming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and the woman is still polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is when everything is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s plate is shaking, and he’s still trying to grab another cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is a scene from a comedy show, not real life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing is just so absurd, I can’t stop smiling.
segments.speaker: PAR
